poem:
Title: Brevity of the Unseen War

In 2050's dawn, silvered in sorrow's haze,
The World's organs - ravaged, tell of chaos untamed.
Health as scattered birds, seeking sanctuary,
From silent tempests within, where battle lines are unnamed.
Hear the whispered numbers, death's cold fraction,
A prophesy of loss, in pity's subtraction.
Yet, in cancer's cruel arithmetic, find also,
The incalculable truth of human grit and glow.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Global cancer cases to rise by more than 75% by 2050, WHO predicts Global cancer cases are predicted to rise by more than 75% by 2050, according to the World Health Organization. Latest figures from the WHO’s cancer arm, the International Agency for Research on Cancer, makes plain the growing burden of cancer, rising from 14.1 million new cases and 8.2 million deaths worldwide in 2012 to 20 million new cases and 9.7 million deaths". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
